trans-unit.source: The MOD function returns the remainder (modulus) of argument 1 divided by argument 2. The result is negative only if argument 1 is negative.

seg-source.mrk: The MOD function returns the remainder (modulus) of argument 1 divided by argument 2.
The result is negative only if argument 1 is negative.

target.mrk: The MOD function returns the remainder (modulus) of argument 1 divided by argument 2.
The result is negative only if argument 1 is negative.

trans-unit.source: The result of the function is:

seg-source.mrk: The result of the function is:

target.mrk: The result of the function is:

trans-unit.source: SMALLINT if both arguments are SMALLINT.

seg-source.mrk: SMALLINT if both arguments are SMALLINT.

target.mrk: SMALLINT if both arguments are SMALLINT.

trans-unit.source: INTEGER if one argument is INTEGER and the other is INTEGER or SMALLINT.

seg-source.mrk: INTEGER if one argument is INTEGER and the other is INTEGER or SMALLINT.

target.mrk: INTEGER if one argument is INTEGER and the other is INTEGER or SMALLINT.

trans-unit.source: BIGINT if one integer is BIGINT and the other argument is BIGINT, INTEGER, or SMALLINT.

seg-source.mrk: BIGINT if one integer is BIGINT and the other argument is BIGINT, INTEGER, or SMALLINT.

target.mrk: BIGINT if one integer is BIGINT and the other argument is BIGINT, INTEGER, or SMALLINT.

trans-unit.source: The result can be null; if any argument is null, the result is the null value.

seg-source.mrk: The result can be null; if any argument is null, the result is the null value.

target.mrk: The result can be null; if any argument is null, the result is the null value.
